The extra feature with Secret Agent Barbie is the attachable device that can be used to assist Barbie with flips and cartwheels. The device attaches to her back, but we found it only semi- useful and not that much fun. The problem is there are limits to what this device can do and it doesn't always work the way it should. It just seems very artificial to have these moves initiated by a device stuck in the doll's back. My kid quickly grew tired of the attachment, tossed it aside, and played with the doll her own way, which was actually better because it encouraged her own imagination.

So, overall, Secret Agent Barbie seems like an okay doll and an acceptable addition to your child's collection. It seems more of a gimmick than anything else and it makes you wonder how the idea got past the new product development team, as it isn't that fun or interesting. Still, it's got enough going for it to recommend.

title: A Fun Doll for the Fashionable and Creative Child
text:
My oldest daughter is a big fan of Monster High and she loves the Frankie character. Knowing this, the chance to get her hands on a Frankie doll was one I couldn't turn away. And, as expected, she liked the Monster High Designer Boo- tique Frankie Stein Doll and Fashions quite a bit and enjoyed creating fashions with the included accessories.

Most people think of Barbie when they think of dolls, but my kid likes the Monster High series better and I would have to agree with her, as Barbie is rather old fashioned and too commonplace. With this set, kids get a more original doll that they can design using the included clothing, markers, stencils, and stickers. This creative angle is the greatest part of the fun and girls will enjoy switching out the clothing and making Frankie look as cool and mod as possible.

About the only issue my kid had with this doll- and one I see that other reviewers have- is that the arms do not bend. This lack of mobility does take away a little from the overall appeal and I don't know why the manufacturer made the doll this way, especially since other dolls in the Monser High series are made with movable arms. Adding some joints, at least at the elbow, would make things better.

Monster High is a popular toy theme with my girl and the Monster High Designer Boo- tique Frankie Stein Doll and Fashions is a doll she likes. She even pulls it out from time to time and continues to play, which is more that can be said for most of her other toys. Other than the issue with the movability of the arms, this is a fun set for Monster High fans and young fashionistas.

title: Great for Young Detectives
text:
Do you have a young detective or two in your home? If you do, then a toy you should buy is Catch the Thief. It offers educational value and entertainment as children set out to use tools, gather evidence, and solve crimes.

My kids like science and problem solving so they took a quick liking to Catch the Thief. They were a little confused at first by some of the clues, but they all come together in the end and make sense once the crime is solved- much like in real life. There are a total of three crimes to solve and my kids had a lot of fun cracking each case.

Some of the accessories included with this game are not really necessary and so are more gimmicks than anything. But the others are useful and more imaginative kids may even introduce their own tools and methods as they solve each case. Again, this is much better than the average toy or game, many of which have little if any redeeming educational or learning value.

It would be nice if there were even more mysteries to solve with Catch the Thief, but what it offers is still good and the price is right. The items included do not get used up, so once the three mysteries have been solved, the game can be used again. It makes a good, inexpensive gift item for children and while not flawless, it is still a good toy/game option if you have kids between eight and approximately thirteen years of age.

title: Your Girls Will Love Making Their Own Necklace
text:
Melissa & Doug make many great toys and children's crafts, many of which are made with higher quality materials yet still sold at a reasonable price. Melissa & Doug Press a Pendant Necklaces are yet another good craft from Melissa & Doug and one that will keep the young girl in your home happy until time for the next craft.

Girls love to make jewelry and other girlie things and this item is definitely made with the girlie girl in mind. The included stickers help to personalize each necklace and girls will have fun assembling a necklace to their liking. There is enough material in the package to create 5 necklaces, making it perfect for your young one to try with her friends as part of a birthday party or gathering.

This craft is recommended for kids age 8 to 12 and it does include small parts. Younger children will not be able to complete this on their own and will need help but children at least 8 years of age shouldn't have any trouble. My girls liked putting together a necklace to call their own and they enjoyed showing off their creative work. About the only issue is that a craft like this won't last very long. This is why I said earlier that it will keep the kiddos happy until time for the next craft- In a matter of minutes, your daughter and her friends will have a necklace assembled and ready to wear. There won't be anything left to do, so it's not a good craft idea if you want something the kids can keep going back to, time and again.

Melissa & Doug rarely fail to deliver the fun and the Press a Pendant Necklaces are another example of a good product from this toy manufacturer, Girls will love assembling their own necklace and once the five necklaces have been made, don't be surprised if your girls ask for another box. It's good, creative fun and most any elementary school age female child will like it.

title: Lots of Fun for Girls, but the Fun Ends Quickly
text:
My girly girls love anything girly. They love to paint their nails and style their hair and that means they have a constant need for head bands and barrettes. Melissa and Doug's Mess Free Glitter Headbands and Barrettes Set was just what they needed for some creative and practical fun.

I have always had a good deal of confidence in Melissa and Doug products and this one did not disappoint. My girls opened the box and started to have fun immediately, taking the 2 headbands and starting to decorate. They got to the barrettes later, but they loved everything and I liked that they were having fun while, at the same time, creating something they need and often use anyway.

I like that this product doesn't contain messy, sprinkled glitter and I like that it offers some creative fun. The downside?- there isn't enough here to keep kids occupied for long. The assembly of a head band or barrette with added accessories and decorations is so simple, some kids will be done within minutes. This is very different from other crafts, some of which keep the young ones occupied for an hour or longer.

Still, my girls do like this headband and barrette set from Melissa and Doug and they both give it two thumbs up. The cute designs include butterflies, flowers, and stars and most any girl will find the set fun, even if the fun is short- lived. It might be a good idea to purchase a second box if you have two girls like I do, but regardless, this is still a nice little toy and it comes with mine and my girls' recommendation.

title: Practice Your Shot in the Home or Office
text:
A simple way to amuse and practice your shot, the SKLZ Pro Mini Basketball Hoop offers glow in the dark appeal, easy assembly, and hours of fun. It hooks on the top of most doors so you can lie in bed and practice shooting or attach it to your office door at work for some quick stress relief.

Out of the box, this basketball hoop requires some assembly, but it shouldn't take long to attach the parts and prep it for use. The hooks that attach it to a door are not adjustable, but they are designed to fit a wide range of door thicknesses. After attaching, you may notice that it lacks stability. I noticed it, too, but I also found that it didn't matter. It doesn't need to be completely stable because the weight of the included basketball is so light. Throw after throw results in no bouncing or other movement for me, so don't worry if the hoop seems less secure than you would prefer. Unless your door is very thin, it should be fine.

Once you have the ball inflated, the toy is ready for use. You may want to set everything in direct light for a few hours at first, to help with the glowing. If you don't, then the glow will be very faint. Still, it should be enough to make it visible in the dark so that, if you use this at home, you or your kids can see it in the dark and play before you fall asleep. One thing that new buyers need to realize is that, due to the thickness of the hooks, it may not be possible to close the door to which this is attached. My door won't close, but I attached it to a door that normally stays open all of the time anyway. If your door won't close with this attached, then you will have no choice but to go back and forth, taking it down and putting it back up.

Overall, this seems like a good toy and it should be fun for the basketball enthusiast in your home. There is no glass and the construction is made to last. The glow in the dark feature could be better, but other than that, it seems like an entertaining way to pass the time.

title: It's Cute and it Makes Cakes
text:
My girls like to help out in the kitchen. They like to create different foods and are fascinated at how everything is put together to create an amazing meal. They like kiddie- related food prep too so I got hold of the Cool Baker Magic Mixer Maker and introduced it to them one afternoon.

Right out of the box, they seemed to love this little contraption. They liked that it is colored pink and they like that it looks just like an actual kitchen appliance. They got it ready, mixed up some cakes, and about 20 minutes later, served a bite to themselves and to me. They seemed to like the taste. I found it rather dull and unmemorable, but I had to remind myself that the mixer and the food it creates are made with kids in mind so if they like it, then that is what matters.

As for the durability, it seems rather cheap and not likely to last. It was simple enough to use and my girls liked turning the crank and mixing up the batter. It did make somewhat of a mess, but not something that couldn't be cleaned up quickly. And I like that the cake didn't require baking. Just 15 to 20 minutes in the refrigerator was all it took to make the cake ready for sampling.

Once the cake mixes were used, I was concerned that my kids would toss this aside, but they still use it from time to time as a regular toy. I almost prefer they didn't because I feel excess use is going to make it fall apart faster. But it's nice to know that they still like using it without the cake.

My kids like to make foods and they seem to like the Cool Baker Magic Mixer Maker. It does have a few issues as I describe above. But it has enough going for it to recommend it for the young chef in your home.

title: Get Slimy in a Clean and Fun Way
text:
SmartLab Toys It's Alive Slime Lab is just one of dozens and dozens of slime toys intended to fascinate the young scientist in your home. The way most of these labs works is similar: Combine the included slime mix, if any exists, with a few household items like baking soda, vinegar, cornstarch, etc., and let the fun begin.

This slime toy works like the others in terms of the mixing, but it is also different than others, and I mean that in a good way. With this slime lab, the mixture is placed atop a motor that vibrates for greater effect. Kids can watch the colors and textures swirl around as the vibrations create some fun and very visual patterns. The instructions include 20 different recipes for slime and each can be made using items found in most kitchens.

What I probably like best about this slime lab is the lack of mess! Okay, there is some mess but in relative terms, the messiness is kept under control very well. The key difference is that, with most other slime labs my kids have used, messiness is encouraged. These other labs involve sticking hands in the slime, spreading it with your hands, and so on. This is messy and gross, and if multiple kids are involved, they often end up smearing it on each other, splattering it on the floors and more. There is no problem like that with SmartLab. The slime, for the most part, stays in the bowl, out of your way.

Educational toys are nice and SmartLab Toys It's Alive Slime Lab is a toy that does get kids thinking and asking questions. My girls like it and have returned to it more than once, creating more slime and learning about household chemicals and how they react. It's a good choice of toy that will keep kids entertained as they learn.

title: Bounce, Ride, Stride, and Have a Little Fun
text:
A good toy for toddlers, the Fisher Price 3 in 1 Bounce, Ride and Stride Elephant helps youngsters develop while having fun. The toy lets then bounce, ride, and walk along as they listen to the sounds and enjoy the light up buttons and songs.

This toy is intended for toddlers under the age of 3 and most will take to it right away. Those on the younger side will like bouncing more than anything while those toward the upper end of the recommended age range will like riding and pushing. My youngest child is outside of the recommended age range, but she is lightweight for her age and liked riding the most. It takes a little bit of effort, but with just a small amount of leg power, young children can push themselves along without any assistance.

Kids will love the sounds and lights that are part of this toy. The good news for parents is that you can shut off the sounds- a feature you don't always get with similar toys. This is nice for adults who get impatient with the constant sounds coming from kids' toys. In truth, the sound isn't that loud or that bad with this toy, but it's nice to know that it can be shut off, if desired.

A toy that encourages activity, keeps kids interested, and helps them develop has all the makings of a keeper and this toy is just that. The price could turn some people away, but it's not too bad and the fun and other advantages make this toy worth the money.

title: Encourages Creativity in More Ways than Expected
text:
My girls love to create crafts. They love anything that encourages artistic expression and they love Play- Doh so the DohVinci Peace Project Complete Design Kit was an obvious choice to introduce to my household.

This design kit contains all of the accessories and material needed to create the peace sign art depicted. The instructions step kids through the process and when finished, they have their own work of art, ready for display.

DohVinci Peace Project Complete Design Kit is a good choice for the creative kids in the family and mine, as expected, took to it right away. What they loved more than anything is the gun tool that dispenses the colors of Play- Doh. They liked making the designs and all we had to do was wait a short time for it to dry and the artwork was completed.

As I said, this craft kit is good for encouraging creativity and I must mention that it encouraged my girls in more ways than expected. I noticed that there was still plenty of Play- Doh left when they finished and I later learned that my girls intended it that way. They purposely used it sparingly so that they would have leftovers to use on other projects. With some construction paper, yarn, and other household materials, they proceeded to create more works of art, much of which were even more interesting than the Peace Project itself.

Creative expression is a good quality and something worth encouraging. With the DohVinci Peace Project Complete Design Kit, kids are presented with something to test their creative skills in a fairly easy to follow manner. It can sometimes encourage even greater creativity, like it did with my kids, making it that much more valuable. The price is low and the benefits are high, earning this kit an easy recommendation.

title: Baby Alive My Baby All Gone Does it All
text:
Baby Alive is an iconic doll. She was one of the first dolls that not only took a bottle, but also ate food, mixed and served to her from premade packets. She has been available in many different versions, each with the same eat/drink concept with a slightly different variation. My Baby All Gone is one of the latest Baby Alive dolls and she will easily keep your little one serving, feeding, changing, and burping her baby for hours.

What sets this Baby Alive doll apart from most of the others in the series is her ability to say so many different things. She still takes a bottle, eats food, pees, and poops just like the other Baby Alive dolls, but for a more realistic twist, she makes periodic statements from her wee little mouth. She will say that she wants to cuddle, that she just went pee, and so on. Her baby- ish voice and cute sayings will appeal strongly to young girls still going through their mommy phase.

My girls are both in their early years of elementary school, but they still like dolls and they like Baby Alive My Baby All Gone Doll just as much if not more than the others in the series, of which they have quite a few dolls. What they like best is the feature that sets this doll apart: The sayings, mentioned above. They like that she says so many different things- more than 30 sayings in all- because it makes her seem more real. I agree that the multitude of sayings is a vast improvement on other dolls that, while they might speak, say only three or four different things. My girls like playing the role of mommy, changing diapers, giving Baby Alive a nap, and everything else that goes with being a mom.

The one disadvantage of this Baby Alive doll is the same disadvantage with the others- you have to constantly purchase refill packs. Trust me, the few packs of food and the small number of diapers will not last long at all! In a matter of a day or two out of the package, your girls will be asking for replacement food and diapers. We have had this doll in our household for only about 10 days and have already ordered a refill pack.

Little girls often like to play the role of a mommy and Baby Alive is one of the best dolls for interactive mommy play. My girls like her very much and I like that they are happy. The cost of the refill packs can add up, so try to improvise when you can or create your own cloth diapers that can be washed and reused. Then watch as the young girl in your household practices her mommy role with a doll that, while not alive, is about as close as you can get to the real thing.

title: Help Baby Alive Heal Her Wounds
text:
Baby Alive Baby Gets a Boo Boo is yet another version of the Baby Alive doll that my sisters enjoyed growing up more than three decades ago. With this Baby Alive, the theme isn't eating and drinking- it's helping the baby heal the wounds on her body.

With Baby Alive Baby Gets a Boo Boo, there is one interesting feature, and that is the wound on the baby's knee. It has a bandage all its own that cannot be completely removed, but can be opened, to check the wound. Each time your child checks, the sore will look different and will slowly heal. This is an interesting concept and not like any I have seen on a baby doll before.

Other than the wound that slowly heals, the other qualities of this doll are not really anything special. Yes, she does drink from her bottle and yes, she goes pee in her diaper and has to be changed. This is actually rather annoying because only one diaper is included and it is ruined and must be disposed of after a single use. If your child really wants to feed the baby her bottle, it might be a good idea to find something permanent that you can just remove and toss in the dryer. Buying replacement Baby Alive diapers can get expensive and prove to be very inconvenient.

Besides the bottle and diaper, Baby Alive Gets a Boo Boo also comes with a sheet of bandages and an ointment bottle that can be used to heal her boo boos. Kids can use their imagination a little bit and pretend they are helping their doll overcome her owies. But once this is done a few times, it may grow old. My girls got tired of this doll after only a couple of days and relegated Baby Alive Baby Gets a Boo Boo to their toy box, where she has been ever since.

Girls love their dollies and a new and different doll is a welcome change of pace. But this Baby Alive Doll didn't seem to pass the test of time in my household. The healing wound on the knee is interesting, but everything else if very ordinary and overdone. It's an average doll overall, recommended only for the die- hard Baby Alive fan and other children who just can't get enough of applying bandages to wounds and checking their status.

title: Disney Princess Water Palace: Mediocre Fun in the Tub
text:
Disney products are always welcome in my house, thanks to my two Disney- loving daughters. They enjoy anything with a Disney theme, at least at first, and can always find something to like, even with the more average toys or merchandise.

Such is the case with this, the Disney Princess Water Palace Playset. My girls did like it at first because, well, it is Disney after all and it does feature the Ariel character, who happens to be one of their favorites. They took to the toy immediately, but they and I lost interest a little bit along the way for different reasons.

From a parent's perspective, this toy is rather cheaply made and some of the parts do not want to stay in place. I had to constantly refasten one of the pieces until I finally gave up and attached a piece of tape. It doesn't seem made to last and its flimsiness means it could be crushed very easily and completely ruined if one is careless.

From a child's perspective, the toy does have some cool features like the slide and waterfall. The Ariel doll that comes with the toy is cute, but my girls were quick to point out that she doesn't really look like the Ariel made popular by the Disney movie Little Mermaid. I'm not sure why they did this. It would have been better to have Ariel look the way she usually looks.

Still, in spite of its shortcomings, there is enough good to be found with this toy to give it the slightest recommendation. It can make bath time more fun and while my girls usually push it aside in favor of more enjoyable toys, they still turn to it every now and then. It's not the best Disney themed toy in the bunch, but it does seem to have enough good points to make it worth buying for the Disney fanatic in your home.

title: A Great Toy for the Young Fashion Designer in Your Home
text:
My girls are fashion freaks. Whenever they can, they will design clothes, setup make- believe runways, and otherwise create a fashionable atmosphere in the home. Their love of all things fashion led me to the Alex Toys Craft Tres Chic Designer Look Back, a toy intended to bring out the young fashion designer in your home.

As expected, my girls took an instant liking to this kit and they are still using it today. There are other fashion toys like this one, but this is one of the better ones for a several good reasons. The greatest among them is the sheer contents of the package. With 390 essentials, there is enough here to keep your young fashion designer going for a long time. The stencil and patterned paper are the best features of the kit, as they keep kids occupied for hours and can be used to creative fun, stylish designs. The kit really succeeds at releasing a child's inner creativity, and that alone makes it worth the purchase.

About the only item I don't find very useful is the included scissors- they don't cut well at all and should be discarded. You will need to supply your own. The manufacturer would be best off if they just eliminated this item. Most homes already have multiple pairs of scissors anyway, so the inclusion of scissors is unnecessary.

Once kids are finished creating fashions, they can store them in the included book. It all makes for a very fun fashion kit that creative, stylish children will love and continue to use for quite some time. In the words of my girls, Alex Toys Craft Tres Chic Designer Look Back is awesome, plain and simple.

title: Sofia the First Palace Playset not a First Rate Toy
text:
My girls love anything Disney. They love the music, the characters, the soundtrack, and most anything else that carries the Disney label. So, when I brought this toy into the home, I felt like my girls were going to like it and enjoy it about as much as any other. They like the Sofia character and I felt fairly confident they would take quickly to any toy featuring her likeness.

Out of the box, this toy requires some assembly. It isn't too difficult, but there was one piece that would not snap into place no matter how hard I tried. I finally gave up and left the way it is. The manufacturer could have already assembled some of the pieces, but chose not to.

Once put together, the toy was ready for play. It is made entirely of plastic and looks nice enough, but I did notice that it isn't very sturdy. The height and lightweight design make it easy to knock over. On the good side, the Sofia character is cute and the toy seemed like it might have enough going for it to score a hit with my girls. Unfortunately, they just don't seem to find this toy all that exciting. I don't know if it's the lack of bells and whistles or the fact that they already have so many better Disney toys. Whatever the reason, they seemed to lose interest in this toy very quickly.

My girls like Disney- themed toys very much, but some toys are certainly better than others and this isn't one of them. It isn't a bad toy, but its design, lack of sturdiness and absence of a wow factor make it very ordinary overall and worthy of only an average rating at best.

title: My Virtual Fashion Show is a Hit in my Home
text:
Crayola My Virtual Fashion Show is a fun way for your little fashion diva to spend some free time. All you do is download the application on your smartphone, tablet, or iPod touch, draw some fashion designs, and then scan them. Your fashion will then show up on an actual fashion model, in 3D, to your child's delight.

My girls are fashion designers in the making so I knew they would love playing with the Crayola My Virtual Fashion Show. It takes little effort to get going. You just add the application to your smartphone or tablet, and then have your child start drawing. Once scanned through the application, kids will be able to see their own fashion design on an actual model. This caused squeals of satisfaction from my girls who loved seeing their fashion on screen.

From my children's perspectives, there is little that isn't perfect with a toy like this, but as an adult, I can see a few issues. One has already been stated by others who have used the device, but bears repeating: The phone or tablet you use will make a difference. Not all smartphones or tablets are created equally and the colors may look a little off. If you have more than one device and it doesn't look good on one, then you might want to consider downloading the application to another device. It could make a difference and it's simple enough to do.

The included accessories with the Crayola My Virtual Fashion Show are a little limited. The small colored pencils are also somewhat of an obstacle, as they are not good for larger hands. But overall, this is a fun fashion design kit and I cannot imagine a fashion- loving child who wouldn't fall in love with it.

title: Yes, it is Gross, but it Gets Kids Thinking
text:
this is still a good starter book on a difficult but important topic.
Science is a great subject that all need to learn better and That's Gross Science Lab attempts to bring the fun of learning to curious kids. It encourages kids to conduct science experiments, each with an emphasis on learning and on creating something, well, gross and disgusting.

My girls love the subject of science and they did like this science set when it was introduced to them for the first time. I was a little disappointed when I opened the box and found it contained so little. You get three molds- one for barf, one for a centipede, and one for a maggot; a toilet mixer; a plastic jar; a bubble wand; spoon; two beakers and a stand. A small booklet with experiment ideas gets kids and parents started so they can create and laugh at so many gross things.

With the experiments, there are a total of 20 and some of them are fun for kids. But one problem I have is that every single one of them requires household ingredients, which you may or may not have. We were still able to do some of them right away because all they required was baking soda, corn starch, eggs, etc. But others required a special visit to the store and this could be upsetting to children and parents who want to open the box and start experimenting immediately.

What you get with this science kit isn't much, but I must admit that it does get kids interested in science even more than before. In fact, that might be the most compelling reason to buy this science kit. It helps pique kids' interests and makes them want to investigate more about the world around them. Other than that, this is a toy of average worth that may or may not satisfy those who buy it.

title: Cute Craft and Looks Great on Any Wall
text:
If your girls love crafts like mine love crafts, then they are bound to enjoy the American Girl Crafts Button Clock Kit. It contains everything you need to create a cute, finished craft that the girl in your home can proudly say she created herself.

This kit contains all the material necessary to create the clock and the instructions guide you through the process. It takes some patience, but most young girls will enjoy the experience. It is a good idea to remain nearby so that you, the adult, can step in and help when necessary. Depending on the age of your child, some may need a little encouragement and assistance, so be prepared to help out. Some of the steps are somewhat tedious and it could try the patience of even the most easy- going child, so be ready to lend a helping hand.

Once the project is complete, most kids will tell you it was worth the trouble. The finished product is a fully functioning clock, about the same size as other round, wall- mounted clocks, but much cuter. It requires one AA battery but like with most clocks, the power is drained very slowly so it will last for many months. The finished clock is lightweight and easy to mount. Kids will be very proud of their work of art and many will want to mount it in their own bedrooms, but others will be perfectly happy placing it in a common area of the house, for all to see.

Crafts are a great change of pace for kids and the American Girls Craft Button Clock Kit is certainly a craft worth considering if you have young, artistic girls. My young girls love American Girl dolls and they took to this right away. It will consume a few hours of time from start to finish, but the experience and the cuteness of the clock are worth it in the end.

title: Cute and Good Quality from Melissa and Doug
text:
My girls love arts and crafts and while they tend to prefer making their own creations by hand, they are not going to refuse something artful that is more premade and ready to use. This is what kids get with the Melissa & Doug Happy Handle Stamp Kit. The set includes ten different stamps, six colors of ink, and 5 colored pencils for artistic fun.

This stamp kit has all of the minimum requirements necessary for some quick and simple fun. Kids will have no problem using the wooden stamps and the colored pencils and they can make all sorts of creations with stamp impressions that include a rainbow, cat, flowers, stars, etc. Six different colors is more than enough variety and children will enjoy stamping the different symbols on other works of art or on a sheet of paper all by themselves. When kids are finished for the day, everything stores nicely and neatly in the wooden box.

The six included ink colors represented the standard colors of the color wheel: Red, blue, yellow, green, orange, and purple. This is great for kids who like lots of choices, but the one obvious issue is the same one other reviewer have mentioned: The colors will get all muddled up if the stamps are not cleaned off. You can lecture and remind kids to clean before changing to a different color, but we all know that most kids will forget. This is why, once the ink is used up, you might be best off purchasing a single color as a replacement.

I have always liked Melissa & Doug product and after using the Melissa & Doug Happy Handle Stamp Kit, my positive opinion remains intact. The colored pencils are not quite as good in quality as the stamps, but the wooden construction, cute handles and designs, and multiple color options make this another worthwhile product from M & D.

title: Imaginative Play with Jake's Hideaway
text:
Jake and the Neverland Pirates is a popular children's program and, like any other popular show, it has spawned its share of toys, souvenirs, games, etc. This particular toy was made for fans of the show and it features a hideout complete with a few accessories to get the action started.

The hideout design of this toy is cute and kids will like the projectile devices and the way the hideout can be closed and opened to reveal the secret space. Once opened, the drop- down doors feature a telescope on one side and cannon on the other. Kids will have fun and most will use their imagination to make up stories as they play. Shooting the make- believe cannon with the included pieces is fun and it adds an element of action to an otherwise mechanical, battery- free play set.

As for the manufacture of the toy, it is made from plastic construction and it seems semi- durable. That is, it should last as long as kids are careful, but certain parts seem like they will break if mishandled. The small pieces can get lost, but this is true of most toys of this type. You can't expect to get a large doll or figurine with a toy designed to fit on a small table top. The pieces are small, so your child needs to keep them stored in a safe place. We haven't lost any yet, but it is only a matter of time until the cannon pieces get lost. I am glad they included three of them in this set. That way, you can lose two of them and still have one, which is really all you need.

One way they could improve this toy is by including more figures, particularly a Captain Hook figure, since he is a major character in the cartoon. As it is presently sold, it is a nice start but many kids will want more. If money permits, I would suggest purchasing this along with one of the Jake and the Neverland Pirate ships, which usually come with a Hook doll. This would really add to the fun and young fans of the show would be most appreciative.

All in all, this is a fun toy for kids and most of them- even those who are unfamiliar with the cartoon- will find it to their liking. It is cute and it has enough action and other qualities to make it a hit with the target age group.

title: Big, Pink, Girly, and Lots of Fun
text:
My two girls own several doll houses. They like having a variety of different houses in which to showcase their sizable collection of barbie dolls and other toy figures. They like using the different doll houses for make- believe play and they like using their imaginations as they place the different dolls inside the house and use the different accessories.

Since my kids already have a good number of doll houses, one might assume they would have little interest in adding another one to the collection. But once they saw this doll house, they fell in love immediately. Easily the largest doll house they play with, they like it most of all and it is the only one not made from plastic. It has a more impressive appearance and the use of wood sets it apart from all of the other doll houses in their play area. The house is close to 4 feet high, 2.5 feet wide, contains 3 levels, and has a large amount of space where even the larger barbies and other dolls can easily fit.

Putting this doll house together takes only a small effort and once complete, I must agree with my girls that it does stand out in the doll house crowd. The wood is pressed board, but it is still stronger than the materials used in other doll houses. Most others are made from plastic and the plastic is thin, making it easy to accidentally bend or otherwise ruin the doll house and its accessories. I don't see that type of problem here. As long as the kiddos can keep moisture away, this doll house seems like it was made to last. And the accessories are large, too. Most accessories with other, smaller doll houses are so tiny, I can reasonably expect my girls to lose at least one every week. But these pieces are much larger than average and are easy to contain.

A pink, girly doll house is just right for those with young lasses and my girls have certainly taken a liking to this doll house. It ranks as their favorite one of all and judging by its size, appearance, and wood construction, I would have to agree that this outranks all other doll houses in our home and is certainly deserving of a five star rating.

title: Toddlers Welcome and No Drivers License Required
text:
Toddlers like most any toy with moving parts and the Peg Perego John Deere Mini Power Loader is just the toy for some fun, safe action. It looks much like an authentic John Deere tractor and young children will love it the moment they take the seat and take control.

This tractor utilizes a rechargeable motor and it reaches a speed of only about 2 miles per hour, so kids are safe. I wondered at first about the safety of this toy more than anything, but the slower than expected speed put my mind at ease. The fact that it auto- brakes is also a plus. I wasn't too sure how this vehicle would stop, then I learned that it automatically brakes the moment the child lets go of the accelerator. And even if a child is moving at full speed, there is really not enough momentum to cause any injury.

Now, to the fun side of things, because fun is going to be what kids will judge the toy by. From what I have seen, kids are absolutely crazy about this toy. I mean, what toddler wouldn't like climbing aboard a vehicle and making the scoop move and wheels turn by using levers and pedals? Some are pleasantly surprised at first because, while they have likely played with other climb- aboard toy trucks in their day, they have never been on one with an electric motor. The pleasant surprise will have them hooked and, once they start, you may have a hard time getting your child to get off the seat.

This toy is a little more expensive than most other toys in your child's room, but the fun they experience, the safe operation, and the lack of the need to buy replacement batteries makes this toy a hit. It's a good option for the preschooler who has everything and wants something new and different from the usual, self- operated toy truck or car.

title: Slick and Stylish Vehicle from Monster High
text:
Monster High toys and accessories are a huge hit with their fan base and the Travel Scaris Convertible vehicle is bound to be a big hit with kids who love Monster High. It is a stylish and attractive toy vehicle with a design that sets it apart from the average kid's toy vehicle.

I'm not usually very impressed with toy vehicles because I have seen so many of them and because most of them look very similar. But this toy vehicle grabbed my attention. The cool, eye- catching, all- around design pattern is one that is bound to warrant a second look and both adults and kids alike will find that it easily stands out against other toy vehicles.

Aside from the exterior, this Monster High vehicle does have other features that make it cool. The stylish wheels glide smoothly across a tile floor or a table without any problem and the vehicle seats up to four Monster High dolls. Rather than have all four dolls face forward, this convertible is a two- seat model with a pair of seats that are actually on top of the trunk, where the dolls face backward. Again, it's something unique that you don't find with other toy vehicles.

The Monster High Travel Scaris Vehicle doesn't have any lights or sounds. This may bother some youngsters, but it is better from an adult perspective because it means no batteries to buy and more imagination required. Most kids will not mind anyway- they will find the vehicle so cool and fun that they will not even notice that it doesn't make noise or have any lights. And another advantage is that boys and girls both seem to like this toy. Girls like it because its Monster High and boys like it because, well, it's a vehicle, which is a toy normally associated with boys.

This Monster High vehicle doesn't have opening side doors, and this is one quality that I wish was different because it would not only look cool, but it would also make it easier to place the dolls into the seats. But other than that, this is a fun, nice- looking toy that belongs in the home of every Monster High fan.

title: A Fast- Paced Dice Game for the Entire Family
text:
Flash is a simple yet fun dice game for the entire family. It consists of six sets of six dice, each distinguished by a different color, six numbered chips for scoring, a score pad with eight challenges and a small pencil, and a storage bag and instructions.

Flash is a fast game and this is one of the reasons busy parents and others will enjoy playing it so much. The object of the game is to complete each of the eight challenges faster than your opponents and what makes it move so quickly is that everyone plays at the same time, racing against each other to see who can complete the challenge the most quickly. Unlike Yahtzee and other dice games where each person plays solo while the others wait, this game offers all- out action through each challenge.

What are the challenges in Flash? Well, they are basic numbering combinations such as six of a kind, a straight, etc. It sounds like it might be difficult, but it really isn't because each individual die has a flash (lightning bolt) on one side that counts as a wildcard. All you do is throw your dice, keep the ones that you need, then pick up the other dice and throw them again and again until you meet the challenge. Whoever completes it first yells "Flash" and picks up the highest scoring chip. Everyone else keeps throwing the dice until they get the challenge correct, but they get a lower scoring chip, all the way down to the number 1 chip. Play continues through all of the challenges and the highest scoring player wins.

The simplicity of this game is one of its strongest points and kids seem to like it more than a game such as Yahtzee for several reasons. First, the speed- it's an all- out battle to see who can meet the challenge before anyone else. Second, every challenge is certain to be met, in contrast with Yahtzee where you may or may not be able to complete each of the items on the score sheet. The scoring is simpler, too, and I like that the manufacturer included a small bag in which to place the dice, chips, pencil, and scoring pad because they would eventually get lost without it.

If I had to look for something to criticize with this dice game, it would be the fact that the challenges are really not that challenging. No matter how bad your luck may be, you will be able to complete each and every challenge- usually in two minutes max. It is only a matter of time until you roll the right numbers on the dice and the wildcard flash makes each challenge that much easier to achieve.

Family game night is part of growing up and Flash is a good game to have around on those nights when you want some family entertainment and only have about 20 minutes or less to spare. It's a fun little game that most anyone will find worthwhile and worth playing.

title: Fun Toy as long as the Cups Stay in Place
text:
Barbie is a popular hero in my home. My girls love most anything related in any way to the glam doll with the long blonde hair and because of this, I was confident they would like the Barbie Sisters Twirl and Spin Ride. It seemed like a fun toy to enjoy while they played with their Barbie dolls each day and, as expected, it was welcomed into my home by my girls with open arms.

Out of the box, this toy requires some assembly, but one pleasant surprise is that it is easy to figure out how to put it together. My girls assembled it completely, on their own, without even bothering with the instructions. They just took the pieces and rationally figured out what went where. In no time at all, the toy was assembled and ready for play.

As for the entertainment value, this toy scores more hits than misses. The fact that it is Barbie- themed is enough to make it a hit in my home, but my girls liked in for other reasons, too, like the fact that it features an amusement park ride. The three cups/cars turn around much like the scrambler or teacup rides popular at carnivals everywhere. The movement is manually directed- you have to turn the knob at the top to make the three cups spin. The dolls are held in place by a plastic belt so that they can twirl around without falling out. My girls love carnival rides, so the amusement park theme was yet another reason to like this toy.

From an adult's perspective, I find several things to like about this toy. Besides making my girls happy, I like that the toy comes with a Barbie doll and doesn't take batteries. But there is one problem with this toy and that is the tendency of the three cups to fall out. The problem is that they are very lightly held in place. They do not snap in firmly and the slightest nudge will knock them off of the base. Re-attach them and, depending on the weight of the Barbie riding in the cup, they may fall out again. This will frustrate many youngsters and parents who have to continuously put the cups back into place.

Barbie is beloved by young girls everywhere and the Barbie Sisters Twirl and Spin Ride Playset is a fun little toy to keep them amused and encourage some imagination. I wish the manufacturer had paid a little more attention to the attachment of the cups, but other than this, the Barbie Sisters Twirl and Spin Ride Playset is a good toy that my girls agree is a toy worth owning.

title: Disney Princess Royal Castle is okay, but nothing great
text:
Disney Princess Royal Castle is a cute castle that is sure to be a hit with young princesses everywhere who are addicted to the Disney Princesses and love anything associated with them. This castle is much like other Disney castles available on the market, with a few added accessories and everything a young girl needs to enjoy hours of imaginative play.

I have two girls who have been Disney fanatics since a young age and still love anything related to Disney- especially the princesses. Their love of Belle, Snow White, Sleeping Beauty, Aerial, and the other princesses was reason enough to bring this toy into the house. Taking it from the box and assembling a few items was all it took to get the castle ready for play. In no time at all, they were running upstairs to find all of their Disney Princess dolls and bringing then downstairs to play with their new castle.

Disney Princess Royal Castle is a cute castle and very girly in appearance, making it just right for Disney Princess fans. My girls like the castle and they love anything that accommodates their Disney princess dolls. They also like making up stories as they play, but they and I both agree that this castle isn't they greatest one with which they have played. One reason is the lack of any sound effects, movements, etc. I am thankful that the castle includes no lights or anything that requires batteries, but it would be nice if it at least offered some mechanical movements, sound chips, or something else. Another issue is the small upper level. This is where the bedroom is located and it is much smaller than the area below. It would be better if the two levels were a little more even.

My girls love anything Disney Princess related and they like this castle, but they do not rank it among their favorites and it is easy to see why. The lack of at least a simple sound effect, the small number of accessories, and the lack of folding or another way to make storing easier all add up to an average toy overall.

title: She Swims and Flaps Around, Just Like a Mermaid Should
text:
Moxie Girlz Magic Swim Mermaid Doll is a toy ready to take to the water and start swimming. The doll takes two AA batteries and has no on/off switch. Instead, you just place her in the tub, swimming pool, etc., and once the moisture- sensing mechanism detects water, the mermaid starts to swim.

Judging this doll by my girls' reactions, Moxie Girlz Magic Swim Mermaid Doll is a big hit and worthy of a high rating. My girls' love mermaids and they love the water. They love Barbie and, while this is not a Barbie doll, it does look like one and that only adds to her appeal.

This doll is interesting in the way she starts to swim upon touching the water. I didn't know she worked this way at first and I kept looking for an on/off switch that wasn't there. A quick check of the internet and I learned that the doll turns herself on and off. However, I noticed that she doesn't stop flapping immediately. She will continue to squirm and flap when taken from the tub and my girls have described it as a little creepy. It takes time for her to stop.

So far, this doll has held up but it just seems like a matter of time until something goes wrong. The batteries are one concern. They are difficult to get in and out and part of the reason is because the compartment needs to be water tight. In my estimation, it seems like only a matter of time before the water seeps in and the doll malfunctions or before something else goes wrong. I noticed from reading other reviews that this has already been the case for others. I will keep my fingers crossed, but I won't be that surprised if the doll stops swimming at some point.

Still, rated for what it is and for the joy it has brought my girls, this seems to be a good toy. It has been loads of fun for my girls who continue to play with it every time they take a bath. They will likely use it until it breaks down completely- I just hope that moment isn't just around the corner, like I fear.

title: Let Your Little Ones Nurse the Lalaloopsy Littles Sew Cute Patient Back to Health
text:
Lalaloopsy Littles Sew Cute Patient Doll is a cute little doll with accessories to help young mommies take care of her and make her feel better. Dressed in her evening attire with a cast on her leg, she wants nothing more than for your child to cuddle her and nurse her back to health.

This little doll wants to regain her good health and kids can help by feeding her from her bottle, listening to her heart beat, and/or washing away her sores with warm water. She has two sets of pajamas and a bathrobe that can be interchanged whenever a child likes and her heart makes different sounds like that of a ticking clock, a frog, and a whistle. The heart sounds will result in endless giggling from most kids as they press the doll's belly and listen through the included stethoscope.

My girls like this doll and more than anything, they seem to like the stethoscope and listening to the sounds from the doll's heart. They like changing the dolls clothing, too, but one surprise is that they didn't get too thrilled over the feature whereby the doll's sores are healed and disappear. You add some warm water to the bandage, apply it to the sores, and they go away. This is easily the most unique feature the doll offers, but my girls were only lukewarm about it.

Lalaloopsy Littles Sew Cute Patient Doll is a cute little doll and, based on my girls' responses, she ranks better than average, but not at any level approaching outstanding. They like taking care of her and continue to use the stethoscope, but they are only so- so on the other features, including the bear, which doesn't do much except allow his limbs and ears to be interchanged. They still play with the doll from time to time, however, and the stethoscope did encourage them to ask questions about the human heart and its functions, so the doll scores some points in that respect.

So, what is my bottom line on this doll? Well, my girls and I agree that she is very cute and some of the accessories are fun. They like the play that the doll provides and even though they do not play with her as much as they play with their favorite dolls, the doll still has enough to offer to make her deserving of a look and she makes a good choice of dolls for fans of the Lalaloopsy line.

title: Ghastly and Colorful in Appearance and Girls Love Her
text:
Bratz Bratzillaz Doll Cloetta Spelletta is a beautifully bewitching doll with plenty of style and color. Her different eye colors, different boot colors, cape, multi- colored hair, and other qualities make her a standout when compared to other dolls and give her a certain unique appeal.

I have two young girls and they each took a liking to this doll the moment that laid eyes on her. They loved her long hair and they liked using the included brush to style her hair and make it look pretty. The doll comes with her own stand for posing purposes, but my little ones didn't care for the stand. They preferred playing with this doll without the stand, posing her on the bed, against a table, etc.

My girls like this doll, but what they liked even more, at first, was the online games accessible through the bratzillaz web site. The doll comes with a pair of cards that are used, via a webcam, to play online games. Kids logon to the web page, start a game, and hold one of the two cards up to the webcam, to activate a magic wand. It takes a steady hand to get the movements just right and it is more challenging than it first seems because the reactions on the webcam are delayed. In the beginning, my girls paid more attention to this game than to the doll itself, but they eventually returned to playing with the doll

Bratz Bratzillaz Doll Cloetta Spelletta is a fun and unique doll, but one thing to keep in mind before you buy is that the magical aspects of the doll could upset some children. Every child is different, but some girls may find the doll and online games both a little too scary because they feature spells, magic wands, potions, etc. For these reasons, the doll may not be suitable for the very young. Kids at roughly the age of six or older should be able to handle her with no problem but younger kids may have nightmares so keep this in mind before you buy.

All in all, Bratz Bratzillaz Doll Cloetta Spelletta a fun doll with a unique look and with some fun online extras. She may scare some girls, but her Halloween- like appearance and unique look are more entertaining than anything and make this a doll worth buying if you have young girls.

title: All Duct Out: Creative Fun for Young Girls
text:
Alex Toys All Duct Out is a fun, creative toy that utilizes duct tape to create all sorts of different things, from jewelry to headbands and more. With included instructions and simple templates to guide, a child can quickly create something uniquely their own in a matter of minutes.

All Duct Out is a toy that could be used by boys or girls, but it is really intended for creative young lasses. I happen to have two such children in my household and they are the types who would rather make something up with their own hands and creative thoughts than play with something that is pre- designed and always turns out the same way. With this toy, kids have something that, while it does include pre- made shapes and direct instructions, is still great for creative fun because there are several different colors and almost always a different outcome. No two items kids make will be the same, so the creative value of this toy is unmistakable.

This toy includes eight, three- yard rolls of duct tape with different colors and patterns. There is enough tape that kids can make each one of the crafts described in the package- a refreshing change compared to other, similar toys. With some crafted toys, there are plenty of choices, but the supplies are limited and kids can only choose a few to make before the supplies run out. With this toy, kids can make everything described in the package and still have duct tape remaining.

My girls like this toy and it is fun to watch them select tape and create the different shapes and designs. But one thing I wish was different is the tape itself- it is difficult to cut because it sticks to the blades of a pair of scissors. The included duct tape is not as sticky as real duct tape, but it is still sticky enough and it will stick to your cutting tool. The best you can do is have one person hold the tape and pull it tightly on both ends, to make it rigid before cutting. This makes the process a little easier, but even then, the scissors will likely stick to the tape and the cut will not be clean. No matter how hard you try, you are bound to cut pieces that are not straight edged and looked torn due to the stickiness. Most kids should be able to tolerate this, but the more perfectionist type kids will find it frustrating.

Creative toys are fun for kids and Alex Toys All Duct Out is a fun toy for girls between the ages of five and ten. A better cutting alternative would be nice and my girls voiced their dissatisfaction with having patterns on only two rolls of tape while the rest are solid colors. But they still like this toy overall and they have created some very cool, very girly creations that they still use and play with several weeks later.

title: Fairy Fun Roller Coaster: No Batteries and Girls Like It
text:
Littlest Pet Shop Fairy Fun Roller Coaster Set is a girl's toy featuring the Littlest Pet Shop characters. It is a colorful, cute toy that offers action without the need to purchase batteries. The operation is mechanical so kids can play as long as they want without the worry of batteries dying out.

This toy is nice for many reasons and besides the lack of batteries, the toy offers some simple operation and continuous action. All your girl has to do is press the lever, which moves the stairs upward and slowly transfers the small figures and their vehicles to the top of the slide where they glide around and wind up back at the base of the stairs. If you continue to press the lever, it will gradually pick up the next Littlest Pet Shop figure and send it up the stairs to the top of the slide where it will, once again, make its way around the slide to the base of the stairs.

My girls like this toy and both they and I find it to our liking. If I had to find some type of fault, it would be the tendency for the small vehicles to sometimes get out of place when they reach the base of the stairs. I haven't witnessed any problems with the vehicles gliding smoothly down the slide- the only problem I notice is that the little vehicles will sometimes get out of place at the stairs, requiring some manual assistance to re- position them. This is most likely to happen if kids get carried away and move the lever too quickly. Keep the speed at a moderate to slow rate, and there shouldn't be any problem.

Mechanical toys are nice and even though the Fairly Fun Roller Coaster Set has little or no educational value, it is still a nice toy for girls in the target age group. It is cute, colorful, and provides hours of simple amusement without the need to purchase batteries.

title: Fisher Price Loving Family Dollhouse: Creative Fun for Your Girls
text:
The Fisher Price Loving Family Dream Dollhouse is a nice size dollhouse that can keep kids entertained and happy for extended periods of time. It has multiple levels, sound effects & lights, and several included accessories for hours of fun.

This dollhouse is a little larger than I expected and it does require a small amount of assembly. The majority of the dollhouse is already assembled and ready to go- only a few pieces need manual attachment and a phillips screwdriver is all that is required. The finishing touches involve attaching stickers, so the kids can help with that part. A few small batteries complete the job, and the house is then ready to use.

The Fisher Price Loving Family Dream Dollhouse has many fun things to offer and judging by my girls' reaction, the positive points seem to be spread among many things. The sound effects are fun and my girls did get a little carried away at first; pressing the buttons and listening to the sounds over and over again. After a while, much to my relief, they stopped pressing the buttons and settled in for some general play. They decided to use not just the included accessories and family, but also some of their own Barbie dolls for added fun. They made up stories on their own as they moved the dolls and accessories from room to room.

The Fisher Price Loving Family Dream Dollhouse is made from plastic but has a solid construction that should last for a long time. The fact that it folds shut is a nice feature because it provides a place in which to store the dolls and accessories. The pieces are small and would otherwise be easy to lose, but this dollhouse is designed to hold everything in place.

Looking for some potential negatives aspects of this dollhouse, I can only find a couple and they are minor. One is the fact that there is no built- in handle to pick up the dollhouse and carry it around. However, the large open windows can serve that purpose, so it doesn't really matter. The dollhouse also lacks a kitchen, which is a little unusual, but kids can use their imagination, designate one of the rooms as a kitchen, and even add their own kitchen accessories from other toys. So, once again, the flaw is really too minor to matter. The same could be said of the batteries. Most of us hate having to replace batteries, but the sounds and lights are not essential parts of the toy. Your kids can still have fun and some parents may even opt to leave out the batteries completely.

Girls love dollhouses and the Fisher Price Loving Family Dream Dollhouse is a very nice dollhouse from Fisher Price that continues to provide hours of fun for my girls. True, it does surrender to the technological age in a small way by including sounds and lights and it does require batteries, but the electronic enhancements are only slight. There is still plenty of creativity to go around, making the Fisher Price Loving Family Dream Dollhouse a very good toy and one that my girls are going to enjoy for a long time.

title: Green Toys Build a Bouquet: Recycled Materials and Creative Fun
text:
Green Toys Build a Bouquet Floral Arrangement Playset is a toy made with greenness in mind. It is manufactured with recycled materials and is great for environmentally- conscious parents who wants their kids to have some creative fun while also minimizing environmental impact. Designed for children between the ages of three and six, it is one of the few building toys that doesn't involve blocks or other interlocking rectangular pieces.

This toy involves building arrangements of flowers on a green, branch like base and there is no end to the different number of creative arrangements that kids can make. The pieces consist of leaves and three different flowers and they can be stacked and arranged in any number of ways. The combinations are endless and every time my girls play, it turns into a new adventure. My girls love creative toys, flowers, and art, so a toy like this is very likeable and enjoyable to them.

I like that this toy is made using recycled materials and I like the small, cube- shaped box included for storage. Most manufacturers do not even think about including a small storage box, and this often forces parents to use plastic bags or plastic containers to store the pieces. With an included box, there is no need to reach for these environmentally- unfriendly storage receptacles that may one day wind up in a landfill. Instead, you just use the included box, which is also made from recycled material, and the pieces will be safe to use for the next adventure.

With its lack of batteries, green composition, and creative encouragement, this toy is certainly a nice change from most others, but does it have any possible flaws or potential issues? I can think of only a few. One is the small pieces. They can easily become misplaced, so parents need to watch closely to make sure that kids place all of the pieces back into the box. Of course, the nice fact here is that you can afford to lose a few because, since they are all interchangeable, it won't prevent the toy from being used again and again. Another issue is that this toy could become boring after a while. There are those youngsters who crave action, lights, and sounds in their toys and if yours is one of them, then they may grow tired of the toy in a short time.

Recycling is certainly a good idea and creative toys that require imagination and not so much of the lights and sounds so common with kids' toys today are definitely a nice change of pace. Green Toys Build a Bouquet Floral Arrangement Playset is a very nice little toy from Green Toys and it makes a great choice for these reasons. The possible building combinations are endless and while some kids may tire of it in a short time, it still has enough positive qualities and creative entertainment value to make it worth a purchase.

title: Baby Alive Wanna Walk: She Talks, She Walks, and No Diapers to Change
text:
Baby dolls continue to change each year as manufacturers look for creative enhancements and ways to make the dolls more up to date with modern times. Baby Alive Baby Wanna Walk is a good example of these changes in action. She can walk on her own, makes more than forty different statements, responds in ways that are suitable to what is going on around her, and has bilingual ability.

The original Baby Alive doll was pioneering because she was the first doll, as far as I know, that could eat food. This doll uses the Baby Alive name, but rather than eat and drink, she shows her realistic abilities by walking and talking. This is not only a nice change from other dolls, it is much more cost effective for parents. One problem with the eating and drinking dolls is that you have to continuously buy food packets and new diapers. There is no such expense with this doll. She devotes her time to walking and talking and about the only necessary maintenance is changing her batteries.

Walking and talking isn't anything original, but the manufacturer made a good effort when it created the different sayings and the way the statements are timed to occur at just the right moment. Baby Alive Baby Wanna Walk says many different things, but she has many more of them than other dolls and she often times them just right. For example, if she stumbles and falls, she will say things like "oops, I'm okay." If she is ready to take a walk, she will say "hold on tight" as she waits for her mommy to take her by the hand. This is more advanced than other talking dolls, most of which make statements at random- statements that have little to do with what is taking place around them.

As for the walking, Baby Alive Baby Wanna Walk is very good in this area as well. She walks easily across a tile floor or carpet and she makes proud, self- congratulatory remarks as she paces from one part of the room to the next. As long as the carpet isn't too thick, she will have no problem. The best bet is to use a flat rug or tile floor. If she does fall, don't worry- she will make a statement of reassurance to the child, then prepare to try again.

Another interesting fact about Baby Alive Baby Wanna Walk is her bilingual ability. She talks in both English and Spanish and her language is changed by pressing her belly. You know you did it correctly when she responds in the other language. This is befitting of the times and it is good for those who speak Spanish and want a doll that speaks the same language. But even I Spanish isn't your primary language, the doll is still good as a teaching tool. It can help youngsters learn some of these common phrases in Spanish.

Baby Alive Baby Wanna Walk is well- constructed and made to last, but bear in mind that this is not the cuddly, stuffed animal replacement that some may think. Since the doll is made for walking, her body isn't soft- it is hard and mechanical. Yes, she will ask your child to hold her and make her feel better, but because her body is made for walking, it isn't cuddly and snuggly. My girls don't seem to mind- they know this doll has one purpose and other dolls have a different purpose. But it is still something to keep in mind.

Girls love their dolls and Baby Alive Baby Wanna Walk is a very good child's doll from Hasbro with unique qualities that make her different from her closest competitors. My girls have told me she is beautiful and fun, and they look forward to each walking and talking experience.

title: Root Vue Farm: Little Value and Several Flaws
text:
Root Vue Farm is a child's toy designed to educate kids on one of the wonders of nature. It is planting device that allows children a chance to watch vegetables grow and see what they look like below the surface of the ground.

When I purchased Root Vue Farm, I intended it to be a good educational lesson and in some ways, it does offer some educational value. It succeeds at getting kids to think more about plants and from a different perspective than usual. Kids and adults are all accustomed to looking at plants above the ground, but not below the surface where the edible parts of many vegetables are found. In this regard, Root Vue Farm is a good addition to a child's toy chest and it seemed like a good purchase.

The problems with Root Vue Farm, however, become evident when you put it together and plant the seeds. Taking it from the box, the first thing I didn't like was the construction. It is very cheaply made, using styrofoam to form the box that holds the soil and seeds. There is an acrylic viewing window, which is fine, but I couldn't believe the manufacturer made the main part of the toy from styrofoam. The use of plastic would have been better, but it appears the manufacturer was trying to cut costs in any way possible.

Next, we added the seeds and soil, watered it down, and waited for the seeds to grow. The first problem we encountered was with mold. The excessive moisture leads to mold growth and since the farm is made from styrofoam, you cannot easily keep it clean. At least with a plastic box, the mold could be wiped off. But you cannot clean this very easily and it stinks.

Waiting for the seeds to sprout also proved frustrating. The seeds do sprout in a matter of days, but they did not reach the point where the vegetables could be viewed through the viewing window. I also noticed weed- like growth on the top of the soil. I don't know where it came from, but there it was, covering the top of the soil.

Educational toys are great and the concept of growing vegetables and observing their growth progress and root network still has some appeal. I may look for another toy with the same concept and better construction, but I will not bother with Root Vue Farm again. Nasty mold growth, styrofoam, and other annoyances make this an educational experience to forget.

title: Fun, Easy to Use Toy with Lots of Action
text:
Kids love their toys and the ones they seem to love best are those that feature action of some sort. It could be sound, lights, or movement- whichever action is available makes the toy that much better in the eyes of a child. The Koosh Galaxy Solar Recon Launcher offers all three: Sound, light, and action and for this reason alone, most kids are sure to enjoy it.

First, let's look at the facts. The Koosh Galaxy Solar Recon Launcher is a plastic, battery operated toy that holds four small, glow in the dark balls. The device can then be used to fire the balls out, one at a time, by pulling back on the front stock. With each launch, the device responds with sound and lights, for added fun.

The Koosh Galaxy Solar Recon Launcher has many qualities that make it a better than average toy. From an adult perspective, I like that the four balls are soft and therefore not capable of damaging anything. I also like that the launcher can be used without the batteries. If you don't want to add batteries or if your batteries have gone dead, you can still use the launcher- it just won't have the sounds or lights. It is nice to have this option that frees parents from having to constantly replace batteries and I wish more toys were made this way, when possible.

Kids like this toy for its action- oriented design, lights, and sound and because the small balls are so light and safe, families with two or more kids might consider buying multiple launchers and letting their kids create their own games as they fire the balls back and forth. The balls are large enough that they are more difficult to lose and are soft enough that they won't hurt anyone- not even the most sensitive child's skin.

The Koosh Galaxy Solar Recon Launcher requires a steady hand and a good aim and it has proven itself a fun toy. Very young children may have trouble firing the launcher but as long as your kids are at least four or older, they should have no problem operating this toy and enjoying hours of simple fun.

title: Artistic Fun for Kids and Priced Right
text:
Ravensburger Mandala Designer Ballerina is a fun toy for young artists. It comes with two stencils and can be used to create all sorts of different patterns and designs with a small amount of skill and some patience.

My girls love art and they took to this artistic device immediately. They are both young and they like using a stencil because it makes it easy to produce nice, neat designs. Kids can fill in different shapes on the stencil and make a varied work of art or concentrate on one item, rotate the stencil, and continue to create the same design to create a circular pattern. Kids can do what they like- there is no right or wrong answer with an artistic toy such as this.

If there were any negative points to bring up with this toy, it would be the lack of more stencils and the irregular paper size. There are only two stencils, and this could be limiting to some kids. In addition, some adults will be annoyed with the paper because it isn't a standard size and thus requires cutting paper to the right size.

Overall, however, this is still a good artistic toy and the proof is the fact that my girls continue to use it long after their first encounter. It isn't anything complex or amazing, but it is fun and is priced low enough to make it worth considering for the budding young artist in your home.

title: Offers some fun, but also some frustration
text:
If your kids like art the way mine do, then you know that they will jump at most any chance to express themselves artistically or to take part in any activity where art is an important component. That most assuredly includes art related toys and this is what led me to obtain the Deco Mandala Designer Drawing Machine.

This drawing machine is actually simpler and less complex then it first appears. It is really nothing more than a stencil apparatus complete with a base that holds the stencil and paper in place for better drawing. You just slip one of the included square sheets of paper through the narrow opening, place one of the stencils on top, and then lock the stencil in place. Kids can then fill in the designs on the stencil with the included pencil and then press the button to turn the paper so that the same design can be drawn in another position.

Among the qualities I like about this drawing machine, one is the rotating feature. I like that it rotates at precise angles so that kids can evenly space their design on a piece of paper, for a nicer presentation. The clips hold the stencil in place very well so there is no slipping and each stencil has enough design options to keep young artists happy. And the included butterfly stamp and punch help add to the artistic qualities of the finished product.

One quality I am not too thrilled with is the insertion of paper. You have to push the paper through the slot and it isn't easy to get it just right. It would work better if the top could be opened and the paper laid down, but it cannot. You have to push it through and that means that some of our budding artists will not push it far enough, resulting in a design that isn't centered on the paper. I also do not know why the device had to be manufactured in such a way that it needs four AA batteries. The only necessary power is to rotate the base and it would seem like this could have been accomplished with less battery power.

This drawing machine comes complete with about ten square sheets of paper. Once you run out- which will not take long- you will have to cut your own paper because the square sheets are not standard in size. Another issue I have is with the stencil itself. The openings are very narrow, which means you cannot use crayons and most other writing utensils. You have to use something with a very long, narrow tip, and that means potentially a trip to an art supply shop to purchase more supplies.

My girls love art and they like this drawing machine, but not quite as much as they first thought. It is still a good toy for the encouragement of creativity, but the manufacturer could have made it better with a few small changes.

title: Furreal Friends Dizzy Dancers Amuse at First, but Not for Long
text:
Kids often like toys best that offer movement of some kind. Flashing lights and sounds also have a certain appeal, but at the very least there needs to be some type of moving action. Furreal Friends Dizzy Dancers is a toy that offers some action and many youngsters will take to this toy right away once they learn how it works.

Furreal Friends Dizzy Dancers includes one pink and one purple bunny. To get the dancers dancing, all you do is insert one of the plastic slides into the bunny, then pull it out quickly. This gets the pointer on the base spinning fast. Like a top, you then place it on a smooth, flat surface and let it spin. The toy offers Mechanical operation, so no batteries are needed.

Furreal Friends Dizzy Dancers are action- oriented and I was surprised by how long the dancers continue to spin like a top after a single pull from the plastic slide. Provided you pull the slide out quickly, the dancers will continue spinning for a while. One game my kids like is to spin both of them at the same time, then sit back and see whose bunny is spinning the longest. They have come up with a few other creative games also, and this surprised me a little at first because the toy seems so simple.

My girls find this toy amusing, but one thing I noticed is that, unlike their other toys, Furreal Friends Dizzy Dancers has little staying power. That is, the spinning just isn't enough to keep my kids interested for long. At first, it seemed like fun watching the bunnies spin and making up games but after the first week, their interest had tapered off considerably. The simplicity of the toy is nice and I am grateful that it takes no batteries, but after one week, the bunnies have already been relegated to the bottom of the toy box.
